website_summaries.verdict: The Asus Transformer Book T100HA is an impressive detachable-hybrid tablet, boasting a wide variety of features, fast performance, a sharp display, and good battery life at a very affordable price.
pros: Strong performance and good battery life in testing
cons: Front- and rear-facing cameras are mediocre

customer_reviews.title: Asus 10.1" T102HA-GR035T Review
customer_reviews.text: This item has really fulfilled my expectation. Compared to other makes like samsung tablet and ipad, I think the price is good for the job it does. I've not had any problems with it since I bought it. In a word it's proved to be a good 'servant'
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast, easy,
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Small issue when using it to write notes on whilst using the pen and the keybord popping up. Fast enough for some simple CAD work and internet browseing. Great that it comes with pen and a very tactile keyboard which has some very nice magnetic attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Aidan

customer_reviews.title: Great quality built
customer_reviews.text: Great quality built. Wifi receiver is good enough if you sit on the router/modem. Barely works in the next room. Processor/ram have difficulties with win10 but for light use its ok. Worst thing is the wifi signal receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Anger

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is around 10-11 hours of use which is very good for the type and size of this notebook.
customer_reviews.text: Good notebook, can be a little slow to respond, the standard web browser, for Windows, is terrible! Battery life is excellent and start up speed is good for the price. Runs well with 1 or 2 programs anymore than that and it starts to slow down and struggle.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Charger port failed first, Decent size and weight. perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years of owning it the charging port has become faulty. It intermittently charges. Otherwise it’s a good item I brought it for work so my clients could interact more with work I'm demonstrating. Bought some nifty Apps and I'm away.
customer_reviews.author: esmerelda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for buisness and leasure
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is value for money. It has the right speed for day to day use and business use whilst travelling. It's not a gaming computer or anything high spec but will keep up for daily usage. The magnetic keyboard is a nice feature too
customer_reviews.author: Scott M

customer_reviews.title: Accents on keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The computer is fantastic so far! The only thing I didn't like was the lack of information about how to use the the accents on the keyboard. My first language is portuguese and I often need to type something in that language.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great wee computer
customer_reviews.text: Great wee computer, so good in fact that the wife has commandeered it, so I dont get to use it much!
customer_reviews.author: Inglis'

customer_reviews.title: Great machine great price
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a small notebook and the description suited my requirements, coupled with the reviews I made my choice. Glad I did, great machine, long battery life and plenty of memory.
customer_reviews.author: Alan J Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Only good for basic browsing. The charger stopped working after 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Jyotsna Maity

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised - arrived as stated - thank you
customer_reviews.author: J Spooner

customer_reviews.title: This is a beautiful tablet, which sadly Amazon couldn't deliver to me ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful tablet, which sadly Amazon couldn't deliver to me from their Logistics depot, I don't know the circumstances, but can tell you it is well worth buying, I got mine from Microsoft when Amazon didn't have any more in stock. I highly recommend it if you can manage to get one. The poor man's replacement for the Microsoft Surface.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Janet V. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: But not that easy to use
customer_reviews.text: OK laptop. But not that easy to use. Using keyboard and mouse and then accidently touch screen can get confusing. Lieft and right mouse clicks not easy. Micro SD card sometimes not recognised. Need to manually eject and then reinsert. On the plus side nice size light, fairrly quick and battery life good.
customer_reviews.author: gerryatkinson

customer_reviews.title: Maybe the best small windows pen pad on the market.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my Eldest Daughter for school work. Glad to report that this little pad battles alongside my wifes surface pro 5. Why? Well small form factor, very fast boot up times. Brillaint pen for home work, runs every package you would need and a decent battery life I'm not really sure whats not to like about it. The only small megative i can think of is trying ot find an decent armor case, thats not down to Asus though. PS. I have lost my girls to this and lynx 8 inch gamer windows pad, minecraft >> all i am told
customer_reviews.author: Rob M

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tablet/laptop
customer_reviews.text: Nice little tablet/laptop. I do find it easier to use a mouse with it when its in laptop mode, but you can pick them up quite cheap. Fast enough for what i wanted it for (web browsing, playing hearthstone and some old games). The only downside is that it's so good, my daughter has adopted it so i barely get to use my own tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs D Rowling

customer_reviews.title: no complaints so far charging up about 2 hours to complete used 128 sd card from my old 2 in 1 & works fine. Only slight problem is the wi-fi connection sometimes ...
customer_reviews.text: i just received mine... no complaints so far charging up about 2 hours to complete used 128 sd card from my old 2 in 1 & works fine. Only slight problem is the wi-fi connection sometimes jumps in & out but i have a wifi adapter plugged into usb port and it is working fine no issues atm. just updating windows any other issues i report back.
customer_reviews.author: Wacker118118

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately had to return it
customer_reviews.text: I think I got a bad one, it happens, had to send it back just picked it up will review later
customer_reviews.author: bulldog

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: was faulty, was a big shame as it really helped with my educational needs.
customer_reviews.author: FeeGee

customer_reviews.title: Good iPad alternative
customer_reviews.text: Daughter uses it night and day for Skype, ROBLOX, YouTube and browsing
customer_reviews.author: Lily O'D

customer_reviews.title: Keep your money in your wallet !!!
customer_reviews.text: Had to return this. Very shabby. Felt extremely delicate. It felt as if there was something not quite right when I tried to charge it for the first time. In the end it did charge up only to completely die that same night. I received my refund in just over a week. But I would certainly say although when it was charged ( for a very short time ) the screen was very vibrant. Still I think the old saying is right, you get what you pay for !
customer_reviews.author: jan.04

customer_reviews.title: Good...but not that good
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I recommend it. It is light weight, yet the keyboard is good, so too the screen and speed. I am very fond of the touch sensitive screen and the ease with which the keyboard can be attached and detached. The orice is good. Much, much better than the Microsoft equivalent Two drawbacks: After 1 year of ownership the 11-hour battery lasts for 70 minutes The mouse pad is difficult to use: insensitive, difficult to control. I bought a Bluetooth mouse
customer_reviews.author: M Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and.amazingly capable for the money.  Some build quality issues
customer_reviews.text: It's not as slow or shoddy as other reviewers might suggest. I replaced a T100 that had stopped charging and was very impressed with what the T102 could do. I can have YouTube on while playing world of warcraft for example. It took a full office package altho there isn't a huge memory left over. The only reason this doesn't get 5 stars for me is that the charger port became faulty. Initially it began to charge very slowly then failed to charge at all. Now it's in the drawer with the T100.
customer_reviews.author: TopCat

customer_reviews.title: Fine for travelling
customer_reviews.text: Fine for travelling and accessing work emails but I wouldn't want to use it all the time as I'd probably go boss eyed. It's a lot better plugged into a monitor. Biggest problem is it scratches really easily, mine was scratched within a day of using it on a cushion.
customer_reviews.author: Fragglemoo

customer_reviews.title: ASUS "Surface Pro" inspired Tablet / PC
customer_reviews.text: As a previous owner of a Surface Pro I was curious to see how this device compared. I was pleasantly surprised to find a device that appears to offer much of the value of the Surface Pro - but in a cheaper package! Great to see other manufacturers finally taking this successful form factor and offering their own take on it! (See my blog for more: [...] )
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: My employer bought this on my behalf and docked the cost from my wages over a few months. If I had purchased it myself I would have brought it back right away. It dies unexpectedly even with plentiful battery life. It doesn't always turn on - sometimes I'm messing with the on button for ten minutes before it will come to life. Sometimes the mouse/courser freezes for no good reason, I have to disconnect the keypad and reconnect to get it going again. I've had issues with the screen flickering also. For the price of it, you could invest in a decent laptop with twice as much power. I recommended investing in something else.
customer_reviews.author: Han

customer_reviews.title: Not great.  Wish I'd gone for Surface Pro or Android
customer_reviews.text: Sadly this isn't a great device. Windows 10 doesn't run well on this 4Gb tablet. It constantly hangs, crashes. It's unresponsive. Regretting the purchase, and wish I'd gone for an Android device or spent the extra on a Surface Pro. Regarding hardware, the keyboard is good, it clicks nicely into the touchscreen, and generally, the device feel's well manufactured, solid, reliable. It's let down by the hardware specification. I've also struggled to use it as a tablet. It doen't feel responsive to finger touch, often takes several taps to close a window. I agree the reply to this review. Surface Pro running with 4GB is great. Asus T102HA with 4Gb, is bad.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. A. Drewett

customer_reviews.title: Awful piece of kit. Took me in excess of ...
customer_reviews.text: Awful piece of kit. Took me in excess of six months to find out that unless you use both the lead and the plug that come provided it won't charge properly. ASUS customer service is non existent. It will charge if you buy an ASUS charger and lead if your first needs replacing, but I has to be both components specifically for this product or it won't charge properly.
customer_reviews.author: C. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Unit failed in 3 weeks of use.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a unit from a high st vendor, but the speakers have failed in week 3. I think that this unit has not had proper CE approval. at £400 better buying another unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

Built from strong but incredibly light magnesium-aluminium alloy, Transformer Mini is ultra-thin and feather-light, with a tablet that's just 8.2mm thin and weighs a mere 530g! Even with the keyboard attached, it's still a slender 13.9mm thin and weighs less than 800g, so you'll never have an excuse to leave your Transformer Mini at home. Working (or playing!) on the go has never been so easy. Audio is Built-in 1.5 Wattage Stereo Speakers with Digital Array Microphone.
